t: The*pn wilderness and the dry land will be glad; the*ln desert will rejoice and blossom like a wildflower.

It*ln will blossom abundantly and*ln will also rejoice with joy and singing. The*ln glory of Lebanon will be given to it, the*ln splendor of Carmel and Sharon. They*ln will see the glory of the Lord,*s the*ln splendor of our God.
Strengthen*ln the weak hands, steady*ln the shaking knees!
Say*ln to the cowardly: “Be*ln strong; do not fear! Here*ln is your God; vengeance is coming. God’s*ln retribution is coming; he will save you.”
Then*ln the eyes of the blind will be opened, and*ln the ears of the deaf unstopped.
Then*ln the lame will leap like a deer, and*ln the tongue of the mute will sing for joy, for*ln water will gush in the wilderness, and*ln streams in the desert;
the*ln parched ground will become a pool, and*ln the thirsty land, springs. In*ln the haunt of jackals, in their lairs, there*ln will be grass, reeds, and papyrus.
A*ln road will be there and a way; it*ln will be called the Holy Way. The*ln unclean will not travel on it, but*ln it will be for the one who walks the path. Fools*ln will not wander on it.
There*ln will be no lion there, and*ln no vicious beast will go up on it; they*ln will not be found there. But*ln the redeemed will walk on it,
and*ln the ransomed of the Lord*s will return and*ln come to Zion with singing, crowned*ln with unending joy. Joy*ln and gladness will overtake them, and*ln sorrow and sighing will flee.
